text: Pope Celestine IV (; died 10 November 1241 in Rome), born Goffredo Castiglione, was an Italian cleric of the Roman Catholic Church and the 180th Pope for two weeks from October 25, 1241 to November 10, 1241. "List of Popes," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2011-11-02. ==Early life== Goffredo Castiglione was born in Milan, but the date of birth is unknown.Society for the Diffusion of Useful Knowledge. (1836). "Celestine IV," Penny cyclopaedia, Vol. 6, p. 400. Castiglione became a Cistercian monk.Beckett, William. (1836). "Celestine IV," A Universal Biography, Vol. 1, p. 720. ==Cardinal== Pope Gregory IX made Castiglione a cardinal"Pope Celestine IV," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-3. on September 18, 1227. In 1238, he was made Bishop of Sabina. ==Pope== Cardinal Castiglione was elected on October 25, 1241; and he chose to be called Pope Celestine IV. His reign lasted only seventeen days. ===After his death=== He died on November 10, 1241; and he was buried in St Peter's.
